alert.note: Alert for Newton; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 9:56PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Newton and central Scott Counties through 1045 PM CST... At 955 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Forest around 1010 PM CST. Hillsboro around 1015 PM CST. Steele around 1025 PM CST. Conehatta around 1035 PM CST. Prospect around 1040 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for central and east central Mississippi.
